Operational Protocol Rationale: Passenger vessels operating under way with engine in this region typically follow fixed, linear routes due to established maritime traffic organization. The vessel’s stable speed, consistent course over ground, and minimal heading variation align with autopilot-assisted navigation along designated eastbound corridors. This behavior is characteristic of structured transit through busy shipping lanes, where predictable motion ensures collision avoidance and compliance with routing conventions. Alternative behaviors such as maneuvering or anchoring are inconsistent with continuous propulsion and directional stability, while curved-path navigation does not match the observed straight-line trajectory.
